attributes.action: Limit government special advisor severance pay to the minimum contract amount
attributes.background: Former Prime Minister David Cameron has overruled civil service advice so his special advisers get severance pay worth £282,000. This is contractually unnecessary and morally wrong at a time of public spending austerity. It smacks of cronyism and the money would be better spent on essential services

attributes.action: Don't Trigger Article 50 until at least after next US President takes office
attributes.background:
In deciding when UK should trigger Article 50, UK citizens demand that Government wait until next President of America has been elected & takes office. Triggering Article 50 should not be before 21 January 2017 
Future US Presidency could become protectionist. Benefits of Brexit could be tenuous
attributes.additional_details:
UK citizens are being told that exiting EU offers opportunity for UK to benefit from trade with other countries outside the EU.
However those in favour of Brexit fail to identify very real prospect that American could become very protectionist.
In assessing benefits of Brexit against real negatives of Brexit, UK government can only but proceed with extreme caution & wait until the election of next President of America & takes office to know for certain future benefits of Brexit.

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: We demand a response to the killing of African Americans by the U.S police.
attributes.background: Following the murders of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling, we demand an official response from Her Majesty’s Government in parliament and international pressure on the US Government, the US Congress and the US Department of Justice to reform its gun laws and police use of deadly force.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years, investigations into the high profile police killings of the following victims have yielded no police convictions:
Mike Brown (unarmed, shot whilst complying with police orders)
Tamir Rice (12 year old shot without question for holding a toy gun)
Eric Garner (unarmed, choked to death)
Rekia Boyd (unarmed girl, shot without warning in the head)
Amadou Diallo (unarmed, shot 41 times)
Sean Bell (unarmed, shot 50 times on his wedding day)
Kimani Gray
Freddie Gray

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs overtaking restrict to inside lane only motorways dual carriageways
attributes.background: Lorries that overtake can sometimes take 2-5 miles to do so and should all be restricted to roughly the same maximum speed, I Believe that all HGVs should be banned from overtaking and be restricted to use if the inside lane only (except if Turing right dual carriageways )
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure we have all spent miles behind a lorry creeping past another whilst blocking a huge queue of cars and vehicles who are clearly faster moving only for the lorry to after an age pull back in front of the other lorry it's absolutely pointless and dangerous and costs money in water time for others and builds anger and frustration in all concerned

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Make all forms of non-medical genital mutilation of minors illegal
attributes.background: Any genital mutilation (GM) of boys and girls, even if they supposedly give consent, should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: GM for religious reasons is particularly heinous as it permanently marks the child as a member of a religion into which no child can be born only inculcated.

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: Make vet check-ups and treatments free.
attributes.background: Many poor families have pets, and if that pet gets into a fight, they might not have the money to pay for treatment.

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Amend MP's Oath to include a commitment to Nolan's 7 principles of public life
attributes.background: Nolan's 7 principles of public life (selflessness, integrity, objectivity, accountability, openness, honesty & leadership) are in Ministerial Code as a conduct guide, but should be made key and an explicit commitment for MPs.  The Oath MP's swear should include a promise to uphold the principles.
attributes.additional_details: Nolan's 7 principles of public life: www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life

attributes.action: A general election to be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down.
attributes.background: This petition is to demand that a general election be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down as Prime Minister. It is not right that a different Conservative candidate be given this position of power without winning a general election.
attributes.additional_details: It is only fair to the people of the United Kingdom that we be allowed a general election to elect our new Prime Minister when Mr Cameron officially leaves his post.

attributes.action: Theresa May must apologise for policies developed while Home Secretary
attributes.background: She should apologise to thousands of wrongfully deported students. She should apologise to non-EU spouses who had to leave the UK because their partner earned under £18,600. She should apologise to Tier 2 skilled workers being forced to leave the UK for earning under £35k, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
She has refused to release court records that prove the students were wrongfully deported. She refused to prosecute high-profile journalists accused of phone hacking, one of which worked for the Government. She tried to ban WhatsApp.

She introduced laws that mean 36% of migrant primary teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers will be forced to leave the UK, due to the Tier 2 settlement threshold of £35k.

She opposes the Equality Act 2010. She has argued against the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Debate the rich poor divide, media bias and its effects on fear of immigration
attributes.background: We want parliament to move debates beyond the fear of migration and what to do about it. To the socio-economic background within which this fear is being nurtured and what to do about that. Including media coverage of the topic, tax avoidance-depriving the UK of revenue & the growing rich/ poor gap.
attributes.additional_details: Open and forward thinking discussion is urgently needed to re-dress the in balance of the economics of globalisation, money markets and the effects of private lobbying within Westminster by big business and private individuals. Trickle down is not working and wealth is pooling upwards instead. Leaving fewer resources for ever greater numbers of people world wide. I believe this is a root cause for the current fear of immigration in the UK which is being fuelled by facets of invested media.

attributes.action: British government should pay costs for 15 year plus ex pats to be EU citizens.
attributes.background: Ex pats that still hold a British passport and have been ex pats for 15 plus years in an EU land and were not allowed to vote in the EU rederendum should have the costs of changing citizenship to that of their current EU home, covered by the British Government.
attributes.additional_details: We had no say in the referendum but we may have to leave our EU homes due to stricter EU rules that may be imposed on British ex pats. This is undemocratic. A compensatory amount of no less than €1500,00 should me made available to any 15 year plus expat who chooses to revoke their British citizenship.  A separate arrangement should also be considered for any British State pension funds that may have accrued.

attributes.action: Make the work-coaches at the DWP Jobcentre Plus work on commission.
attributes.background: I want them to go on commission-only because they don't really help jobseekers to get work... And by that they will only get paid if they find work to a customer and that job is suitable (skills wise) for the customer.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: Cross-party statement condemning hate crimes & a debate on firmer punishments
attributes.background: Since the referendum people have been using the result as an opportunity to express racism and hate. This is to ask all political parties and politicians to come together on a joint statement to stand united against racism and hate. Also to ask for a debate on firmer punishments for hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: This is NOT about how people voted. It's about it being used as an excuse.

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action: Introduce a complaints commission that holds the UK press truly accountable
attributes.background: We petition to replace IPSO with a regulator that actually holds the UK press to account (similar to ofcom), and take measures such as not allowing a complete bias, active investigation of misleading headlines and apologies on the same scale as the original article. Regulation should be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The recent referendum campaign was an example of the how toxic the UK press have become and how well they are misinforming the UK public for ulterior motives. The fact that Rupert Murdoch can use the UK press to the to fulfill his own anti-EU agenda and at the same time maintain a friendship with our prime minister shows just how corrupt the whole system is.  To abide with IPSO is not even mandatory, and the more impartial press outlets refuse to be part of it out of protest of its uselessness.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.

attributes.action: Hold binding referenda in cities/regions to vote on independence from the UK.
attributes.background: Post EU referendum 49% of the voting population are unhappy with the result. 2 countries and many large cities voted to stay, there is a massive divide in the politics, with fundamentally opposed ideas. The UK should allow these regions to vote on independence from the UK in binding referenda.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the uncertainty and issues that will arise from leaving the EU and new political leadership. We should seriously consider the alternative options available if cities or regions were to vote for independence and remain in the EU.

https://ig.ft.com/sites/elections/2016/uk/eu-referendum/
http://www.newsweek.com/london-sadiq-khan-brexit-londependence-independence-referendum-474356
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-36616028
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36626201

attributes.action: Delay submission of intent to leave the EU (Article 50) until there is a new PM
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum to leave the EU & the subsequent resignation of the PM it would not be in the UK's best interests to rush the submission of our intention to leave until a new leadership is in place.  This must be delayed until at least October to maximise the two year period.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports of EU leaders and other member states wanting the UK to submit the intention to leave immediately and begin the two year notice / negotiation period.  Given the likely duration of a leadership contest and the current target of October 2016 this could result in a rushed process and damage the chances of getting the best possible exit for the UK.  This petition is to delay the submission until a new PM and cabinet are in place so they are able to negotiate without distraction.

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age in referendums to 15 and elections to 16.
attributes.background: After the EU referendum I felt powerless to say my opinion because I am too young to vote. However many people at my school have a very large knowledge and definitely would've voted if they had the chance too. The people that these referendums impact the most aren't allowed to put forward their say.

attributes.action: Debate the legality of denying EU migrants the vote in the EU Ref.
attributes.background: Denying EU migrants, on the electoral roll, the right to vote in the EU referendum contravenes EU law (enshrined in the TFEU, Part 2) on non-discrimination based on nationality.
attributes.additional_details: The outcome of the EU referendum has an impact on the lives of non-British nationals resident in the UK. It will also impact on the lives of their families and children. Consequently they should have the right to vote.

attributes.action: Ensure the Brexit negotiating team is politically representative
attributes.background: The UK has just voted to leave the EU and after Article 50 is triggered we will have to negotiate the terms of our disengagement within two years. Our current government gained a parliamentary majority with just 37% of the vote. It does not have a mandate to carry out these negotiations on its own.
attributes.additional_details: Requirements of negotiation: The team negotiating our terms of our disengagement from the EU should consist of MPs from all parties. The final terms should only be considered passed if voted for by a super-majority (66%) in parliament. Each constituent nation's administration shall have a veto over the terms.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: Block George Osborne's emergency budget proposal, if Britain leaves the EU
attributes.background: George Osborne has announced that if Britain leaves the EU, he will be forced to raise taxes and cut spending to prevent an economic meltdown. Not only is the 'evidence' used to suggest this just based on wild predictions and scaremongering, but it also contradicts the 2015 conservative manifesto.

attributes.action: Ensure the EU referendum goes ahead and we get our democratic right to decide.
attributes.background: I want to ensure the British people get their say on 23rd June as to whether we remain a part of the EU or not. A petition calling for the referendum to be cancelled and for the British government to make the decision (to stay in the EU) is circulating. Help ensure the democratic process happens.

attributes.action: Enforce stricter banking regulations for online gambling transactions.
attributes.background: Many online gaming companies offer a self-exclusion service as part of responsible gambling. However, due to the large variety of online gambling sites, it is very easy for problem gamblers to relapse. We want banks to offer a similar self-exclusion service for such transactions being made.
attributes.additional_details: Our suggestions are for a self-exclusion based service being made available by banks to offer a more rigid deterrent to online gambling addicts from which is currently available. We'd also like to see stricter regulations in normal online transactions being made to gambling sites; and question marks being made where large sums are being deposited to help deter online gambling and aid those with addictions or potential addictions to gaming.

attributes.action: Protect identities of those subject to unsubstantiated allegations of sex abuse
attributes.background:
Several big name celebrities have been accused of historic sex abuse  their identities released to the public domain before any of the unsubstantiated allegations have been investigated.
I want to see a change in the law that protects the identity of these persons until charged with any offences.

attributes.action: A law that restricts roadworks to 5 miles in any 30 mile stretch on a motorway.
attributes.background: Over the past few years there has been significant investment in upgrading our motorway system, this has resulted in many miles of roadworks with restricted road width and an imposed fifty mile an hour speed limited that is monitored. Some roadworks go on for 15 miles plus.
attributes.additional_details: Extended roadworks (greater than 5 miles, Incl lead-in/out) with reduced lanes and a 50 Mile an hour speed limit requires significant levels of concentration. It increases the likelihood of an accident, increases traffic jams, restricts movement, increases the time it takes to get from A to B when the roadworks are for extended miles. Drivers get more frustrated, more likely to speed. When there is a 15 mile stretch of roadworks, on large stretches nobody is working anyway!

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Make it law for all bedsheets sold in the UK to be labelled with their size
attributes.background: It's very difficult to guess the difference between the different sizes of sheets sold in Britain. Thousands of wasted person-hours a year could be saved if all sheets were properly labelled so we didn't have to make at least three trips to the airing cupboard every time we wanted to change a bed.

attributes.action: Make 'motorway driving' lessons a mandatory part of the driving license test
attributes.background: The current driving license has no complete section on motorway driving and only includes them within 'Pass Plus'. Motorway driving and motorway etiquette are an invaluable part of driving as a whole and it should be mandatory for motorway lessons for drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The number of large scale roads are increasing dramatically in the UK and with no real lessons or real time motorway education, new drivers enter motorways, sometimes without driving on them ever before. The rules of motorway driving need to be taught to all new drivers. Motorways are a very dangerous place and it is unfair to send a new driver out onto one without them having any previous motorway lessons.

attributes.action: Orgnanise a blockade of the Libyan coast to stop people trafficking.
attributes.background: Around 150,000 migrants travelled from Libya to Italy by boat last year and, so far this year, more than 37,000 people have been intercepted in the Mediterranean and taken to Italian ports. Hundreds are believed to have died after their overloaded vessels sank or capsized.
attributes.additional_details: Lord West, ex-First Sealord and Chief of Naval Staff, said such a measure would require 10 Navy frigates and destroyers, along with helicopters, drones and other intelligence and surveillance capability

attributes.action: Allow electric skateboards on roads as long as there are safety precautions.
attributes.background: Electric skateboards are banned due to them being motorised, they should be allowed because they have low emissions, cause less congestion along with appropriate breaking to prevent accidents. They should be allowed as long as you have safety wear and the companies do appropriate government tests.
attributes.additional_details: Company tests should be top speed test whether it's greater then 25mph maybe, breaking speed test (how long it takes to break). All companies should supply safety wear such as a helmet and a pair of gloves, in the end if these are in place then the board would be just as safe as a bike if not more because the capped top speed. If any of the rules aren't followed by people then if seen by law enforcement they should have their board confiscated and fined £500

attributes.action: stop! the sale of fish tanks under 30 litres to stop fish suffering
attributes.background: the sale of fish tanks under 30 litres is harmful to fish as water parameters dont settle and also not enough room for fish to grow it is cruel to fish and should be stamped out across the whole of the uk pet shops are wrong to sell these tanks

attributes.action: Implement larger capacity trains on Cross Country Train Routes
attributes.background:
Since the start of the CrossCountry train franchise in 2007. Train passengers have doubled and are still increasing however the Franchise still run small 4-5 carriage locomotives.  
Contract for CrossCountry trains is reviewed this year so the Government should consider implementing larger trains.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently CrossCountry Trains implement 3 sets of Trains. 
High Speed Trains that consist of 8 Carriages.
Voyageurs and Super Voyageurs 4-5 Carriages.
Turbo Stars Trains 2-3 Carriages. 

Voyageurs operate in the South West , North East, Scotland, South Coast, North West and North East. They are subject to overcrowding on the majority of routes to unsafe levels of passengers having to stand, sit in non-designated seats and scramble over the first available seat. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West London’s housing and congestion problems.
I believe London’s future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
•Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
•More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
•Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
•In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: Create a NHS and Care Commission to review and manage all health care in the UK.
attributes.background: The 21st C has brought new challenges to the health and care provision which underpins the well being of all in the UK. It is timely to review the NHS to ensure that it meets modern needs but retains the ethos of equality of services and  provision, free at point of delivery.

attributes.action: Offer a free workshop on healthy eating on a budget to all UK residents
attributes.background: Myth; 'eating healthily is more expensive than buying junk food'. Pre-packed food or pre-prepared food can be much more expensive and full of sugars, fats and preservatives than making from scratch. More education is needed to make healthy shopping choices, ultimately improving the nation's health.
attributes.additional_details:
If people are educated on how to read the supermarket price labels of fruit and veg for instance, quite often it is cheaper to buy loose vegetables than it is to buy pre-packed. Educate on how simple healthy meals can be made with very few cheap ingredients. e.g.

Vegetarian tomato pasta dish; home-made total price for a family of 4; £0.89.

If wanting to add meat (Beef mince as an addition) ; Total price £2.89 for 4 servings.

Alternative pre-packed pre-made product, 4 servings; £6.60.

attributes.action: Create more apprenticeships in policing and security.
attributes.background: After trying everything i have found there are minimal opportunities to get an apprenticeship in that professional area due to regulation on overtime and budget cuts more apprenticeships should be created in the security and policing areas to give people the experience required.
attributes.additional_details: I have been told the police no longer offer work experience by members of their staff and the security industry do not seem to provide apprenticeships, i see this as wrong because at a job interview all they will want is experience and without an apprenticeship you do not have that and they will dismiss you and hire an experienced Candidate.

attributes.action: Make the size of motorcyle you are able to get at the age of 19-20 be a 600 cc
attributes.background: it is the threshold of not being too powerful for riders that have been riding for 2 years and allows them to get used to a slightly more powerful bike before they upgrade to an unlimited liscence this will allow bikers to gain vital experience if they feel they are ready to get a larger cc later on
attributes.additional_details:
You are more likly to have a crash on a motorcyle however it should be the riders choice to ride a larger or smaller bike.
This link shows that the rate of deaths caused by motorcycles was falling by 9% in 2012 before the new age restricted Euro laws were applied. And a large number of bike crashes were caused by car drivers not paying attention to them
http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2015/march/new-accident-stats-show-large-decrease
These are the most up to date statistics

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Public Debate and Referendum on Fracking (Shale Gas) in the UK
attributes.background:
Fracking is a controversial process to extract natural gas by fracturing surrounding rock and directly a high pressure mix to release the gas.

I ask for a referendum on whether fracking should be allowed in the UK at all.  Public opinion seems strongly against yet applications are being approved.
attributes.additional_details:
Fracking is once again in the media with the Government ruling that horizontal fracking can go ahead in Lancashire. It follows the approval of fracking at Kirby Misperton in May (although this is delayed to to legal challenges).

There is little consensus on the long term impacts on the area and the surrounding areas after fracking. Examples in the US have resulted in water contamination and air pollution causing headaches and nausea not to mention confirmation of causing earthquakes.

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.
